values:
My new cheese love is Delice!  It is a hard cheese,  Soaked in sweet wine an then aged to a texture similat to Mimolett . It is sweet ,tangy nutty, and just the right amount of salty. Mmmmm! Snacking on some now!
Gives one bad breath, so I must brush teeth good before going out again ;)
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/199901.html

Mondays child is fair of face,
Tuesdays child is full of grace,
Wednesdays child is full of woe,
Thursdays child has far to go,
Fridays child is loving and giving,
Saturdays child works hard for his living,
And the child that is born on the Sabbath day
Is bonny and blithe, and good and gay.

Which child are you?
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/199107.html

So glad this week is over. I am not one to wish my life away, but too much was on my plate this week. Lots done, more to do next week. Looking forward to tomorrow, want to get lots of pots made.
I made several large handbuilt pedestal bowls. Put two in the kiln to be fired tomorrow. 
Before I forget,wanted to say thanks to my friend D.Sibley, over on DeviantArt for making a icon picture with my art in it. I love it so!
We are planning a little weekend away at Bend . it has been two years since we've been there. Going to take the big girl, she loves he state park trips. She is so good to travel with, We love having her with us. Lil' pup will have to be boarded, she is too noisy at this time of her life to take, plus she gets carsick. I have someone lined up to watch the house and take care of Pea.
All that is left is to make the motel reservations.
In store news,the debit card machine will be arriving in two weeks. Very exciting to be able to take debit and credit cards for the first time. We have been cash only for years.
Hope I can keep up with the changes.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/198743.html

Am going to reserve my hotel for Tuscon tomorrow. The plane fare must be purchased by the end of October so i can get a good price. I think I need to be there longer to get everything packed and shipped. Found out the main Dealer i buy from will let me shop over a couple day period and my Gem/Mineral distributor will hold it until i am ready to pay and ship at the show. This is Big deal for me- that means they think of me as a steady customer.
I have to buy more malachite this year. and it is so heavy to ship. I'm going to hate lugging it around. Wish I had a buying assistant, lol.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/198606.html

I worked the shop since my Sunday guy went to Bumbershoot this weekend. I hope he is having a great time, lol! I will be open tomorrow too, as it was busy and the Cafe' goers needed someplace to get out of the rain and spend some of their holiday dollars. 
D is so happy his suggestion to carry wood puzzles Is a big success. We have sold about a dozen puzzles of all kinds since we debuted with them Friday.
I must re-order early tomorrow so they can ship the second half of my order. We are looking forward to seeing what we will get next.
We finished the lamb stew tonight. We were going to do a gourmet weenie roast this afternoon but it just rained and rained. Hopefully tomorrow we can do it.   it would be fun.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/198060.html

Making Lamb stew tonight using scrap lamb pieces from the butcher. I put carrots beans and potatoes in it from the garden. I added store bought onion, garlic, and will add some frozen corn at the end .
The garden is still chugging away although some of the pattypan squash plants are reaching the end of their productive stage. I get about 5lbs of tomatoes a day, and it seems evident to me Sauce needs to be made from the overripe ones. We can't eat them fast enough. A big switch from last year. We did get tomatoes at the end of the season, but we have been eating tomatoes out of the garden since the end of July.  The surprise crop was the amazing productivity of the purple greenbeans. I think the corn will be ready any day. Should check this weekend. I also am impressed with how much broccoli we have gotten from just four plants, delicious, too. 
Gotta check the stew, 
see ya!
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/197637.html

Work: Getting stuff done!
School: Better than ever!
Project: On my bench.
Health o'mine: Better than expected
Crafts: Arts preferred today 
Cooking: No cooking today
SCA: On back burner
Amusements: My laptop computer 
House:Could use attention
Mood: Better than expected
Car: Still going strong
Phone: Charging it now
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/197417.html

Lots of stuff happening lately.
We are harvesting veggies out of the garden like crazy. I have about 5lbs. of tomatoes sitting on the counter, and 10 lbs of squash and green beans in the fridge. We have green peppers to pick, and more broccoli to cut. I had to water today as things were getting pretty dry. Will go out later and get more tomatoes.
Am expecting one shipment after another for the store in the next three weeks Will get to fill the shelves again for Christmas. Makes me happy. I think we will survive this year. Ordering more soap tomorrow. I always look forward to the soap shipment as it smells so heavenly!
Went to the school to drop off veggies and stayed to glaze a few pots. I have a huge pile of biscuit to glaze, Wednesday I better get it done. Hopefully, all of it. I have many bowls to trim out too. lots to do!
The studio is framed and sheeted and as of Saturday evening, has a beautiful new roof. The water is in, and the electrician comes tomorrow.  After that, the furnace man comes to put in the heater. Things are going quite quickly now.
Don't forget, all on my friends list are invited to the weekend long Studio warming Date to be announced. I am trying to find a date that won't conflict  with my event-going SCA pals.

SCA Folks; Any date suggestions for October or early November?
Please comment!
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/196918.html

Last Friday I went to the gem show. I actually found gem beads I wanted to buy. They were discounted and of excellent quality. My fav. dealer from Texas was there, and we where wheeling and dealing.  came home with faceted ametrine, garnet, citrine and amethyst. Plus he had great 2$ specials and i filled a big bag with those.
Saturday after noon was day one at the Gift show .I ordered more Siberian birch wood boxes. At the cash and carry section of the show, I bought tibetan silver from my friend Dolma. She lives in California.Some day I will fly down and visit her.She lives just north of San Fransisco.
I could not find my french soap dealers, and I'm out of a lot of scents, so panic is setting in. Should I order direct? Still need to order my Christmas animals and ornaments from the floral place. Will leave around noon today and get that done.
 TTYL, bye.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/196846.html

This group never did anything. So I didn't think i would keep this blog going any more. If I do  any paranormal investigating it will be with my friends and not with these folks. Please un-friend at your leisure.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/196527.html
Catching up on ceramics postings Small porcelain tray Porcelain polkadot bowls Porcelain mugs
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/196275.html

What a day. One crisis after another. But the worst started at 9:39 this morning... Cue swirly harp music and wavy picture of me standing by my phone screening my call.
"Hello? this is your neighbor, xxxx xxxxx, and I'm upset because i can't sleep in. Your construction is waking my kids up early and and how dare you. My children are on their vacation and they have a right to sleep in. Oh and by the way, my mother and teenage daughter have seen your construction workers pissing in the bushes on your property. And I'm calling the sheriff on you, youaredisgusting how can you allow them to do this!!!! My teenage daughter is horrified. Youaregoingtojail.Callmethisinstantmynumberisxxxxxxxxxxx!!!!!!!" Click. 
WTF?
They are peeing in my yard?
I had to listen to the screaming phone message about five times to decypher the phone number. wrote it down, and then called my construction manager. He laughed at me And i told him it wasn't funny. He changed his demenor and got serious. I called him just a little later and apologized and we laughed about it. A porta-potty was delivered shortly after noon. I could care less if she can't sleep in, but-
No more peeing in the yard.

Edit to add:
This is the neighbor I had to call the sheriff on last Summer because she was chasing and attempting to strangle her teenage daughter while screaming obscenities. For over two hours. Also holding the 16 year old boyfriend hostage blocking him in and refusing to call his parents at his request. She assaulted him too. This happened a second time without the boyfriend at ten o'clock at night about a month later. I think she felt she wanted to pay me back.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/195905.html

I went through the store and checked on my inventory. I was very surprised to see how much jewelry was sold this month. Our inventory is pretty much raped and pillaged. So that means some serious bench time. Less goofing off on the 'puter is in my immediate future.  This weekend is the last Gem and Jewelry show this year and I am in desparate need of findings. So that is a must do. The Gift Show is this weekend too, so I told the husband he will have to do the pottery thing without me this Saturday .I have to re stock my Provance soap line. I'm wiped out of that. Gotta get prepared for Christmas this year. I need to do well this season to survive. Last season was ruined by a parking lot filled with two to three feet of snow.

What Greek Goddess are you?


You are Athena!
Born from the head of Zeus himself, this goddess is the most respected and capable of all the goddesses. Like this goddess of defensive warfare, crafts and wisdom, you are courageous as a warrior, cunning as a fox, and wise beyond your years. You do not try to be a leader, but you are one merely because you have the raw material that renders admiration and followers. Though you may not know it...you have the world at your feet. But since you are wise, you will not allow this newfound knowledge to go to your head.
How do you compare?
Take this test! | Tests from Testriffic
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/177435.html

Today belonged to the dogs. They were scheduled for their semiannual shots and  checkup. Lil' pup went at 11:40 The big girl at 2:20.
I can only do one at a time 'cause  the  little one is terrified to ride in the car.
Results:
Both in perfect health, The little one's ears had wax buildup but no inflammation . Go me!  The exclusive diet is working great!  
Doc said my older girlie was in super shape for her age. Yea!  Makes me happy.

You Are Engaged
You feel completely absorbed and intrigued right now. You're cheerfully busy.
You're alert and completely involved with everything you do. You don't walk through life half-asleep.

If you're interested and engrossed, then you feel incredibly happy.
You are constantly curious and never bored. There's too much to be fascinated with!
What Kind of Happy Are You?

Your result for Which Were Animal Would You Be? Test...

You are a Were-Fox!

50% fox, 30% wolf, 20% horse, 40% tiger, 30% leopard, 40% rat and 50% bear!

A fox is a predator, yet they can also be scavengers and foragers.

As a werefox you will be agile and athletic. You will take your prey by surprise. You won't be only dieting on raw flesh, but will eat a variety of foods including fruits and berriers. Therefore, your new persona will be easy to hide from humans.

You will be mostly nocturnal. If someone does manage to track you your cleverness and cunning will make it a very difficult task for them. You will easily confuse those persuing you, because you will be very unpredictable.

You will have one mate, and a lucky mate indeed. Foxes are monogamous creatures.

Take Which Were Animal Would You Be? Test at HelloQuizzy

You are The Star

Hope, expectation, Bright promises.

The Star is one of the great cards of faith, dreams realised

The Star is a card that looks to the future. It does not predict any immediate or powerful change, but it does predict hope and healing. This card suggests clarity of vision, spiritual insight. And, most importantly, that unexpected help will be coming, with water to quench your thirst, with a guiding light to the future. They might say you're a dreamer, but you're not the only one.

Random stuff
I leave in two weeks for Tuscon.
I really love the glazing class I'm taking. I wish there would be another session. Six weeks is too short.
Thanks to Wendy, my house is looking much better.
I lost a pound and a half in two weeks.
Started Curves again.
I miss my friend Shirley.
Making my shopping list for Tuscon....

Hi, 
Time for an update on what's happening.
I have been working on assembling the necessary equipment to start investigations.
i have: 
night vision camera 
EMF meter that lights for Q&A sessions
second Emf meter for more precise measurements 
Sony digital voice recorder.
Laptop and software for analysis
So, I am pretty much set to go.
except for the Infra red lighting
Which I am going to try and find in the next two weeks.
Still looking for volunteers to man equipment.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/167804.html

You Are Seductive and Ruthless
You are the total package - suave, sexy, smart, and strong.
You have the whole world under your spell, and you can influence almost everyone you know.
You don't always resist your urges to crush the weak. Just remember, they don't have as much going for them as you do.

You tend to be pretty tightly wound. It's easy to get you excited... which can be a good or bad thing.
You have a lot of enthusiasm, but it fades rather quickly. You don't stick with any one thing for very long.
You have the drive to accomplish a lot in a short amount of time. Your biggest problem is making sure you finish the projects you start.

You are balanced, orderly, and organized. You like your ducks in a row.
You are powerful and competent, especially in the workplace.
People can see you as stubborn and headstrong. You definitely have a dominant personality.

You are well rounded, with a complete perspective on life.
You are solid and dependable. You are loyal, and people can count on you.
At times, you can be a bit too serious. You tend to put too much pressure on yourself.

You are very intuitive and wise. You understand the world better than most people.
You also have a very active imagination. You often get carried away with your thoughts.
You are prone to a little paranoia and jealousy. You sometimes go overboard in interpreting signals.

You are usually the best at everything ... you strive for perfection.
You are confident, authoritative, and aggressive.
You have the classic "Type A" personality.
What's Your Name's Hidden Meaning?

Does anyone want to swap their craft for some of my pottery?
I think that would be fun and Folks, I'm swimming in pottery- help me, plz!

http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/166939.html

Many things going on 
First, I am finally baking Cissa's turkey and stuffing casserole in the oven. And, I may I say,it smells like heaven. Browning the potatoes on top . This time I made my potatoes with cream and butter.

Things are rolling along on the studio,  I thing we have a winner!

My trip to Arizona is getting closer . I won't be able to spend so freely this year but i expcet to get a good selection of items. Want to get some British Colombian Jade items this time.

*I stopped this post to eat- I think the casserole is Super-Yummy!!!!!!
Oooh, and there are leftovers!!!!! 

Visited with the Publishing company who used to make the Crier for us. I think It is good to stay in touch with important businesses. Snohomish Publishing made all the tags cards and stationary for my personal business two years ago. I will use them for the paranormal paperwork, too.
*******************

Been pondering:
What will be my role in the SCA in the future.
Since 1982,I have always had a "purpose" in the SCA, a job, an activity, a guild, teaching,- none of those things exist anymore and I have nothing left.
I need to find a "group" as in people not as in a "official group" I can find acceptance in  and feel like I can be myself and find my place again. I  There isn't much tying my to the SCA these days.
I feel adrift, alone.
What scares me the most is that I used to Love, love this organization.
now I feel like a complete outsider and no one wants my skills or help.

*Sighs*
Gads, I'm in a mood now....
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/166863.html

I made lamb and beef stew for dinner tonight. It turned out a little bland since I had to omit the Guiness beer I usually put in. I forgot to buy some at the grocery store. Wah.
Am working on my taxes which sux 'cause they changed the forms.... 
I found a couple super sekrit sites to do some investigations at when it warms up. ;) Am really excited about it I found some very old maps that bring to light some intriguing  places.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/166427.html

Soon I leave for my annual trip to Tuscon Arizona. I am looking forward to going. I guess I always do- I am never bored all day going to the shows and I can blog about it at night to keep busy. I will be packing and shipping stuff starting from day two so I don't have to hurry at the end.
I only reserved 12 days at the hotel this time. D doesn't seem to do well without me for a whole two weeks at a time. This will be my shortest trip. I will save money on the hotel bill for sure.
Am going to pick up some more loose gems and certainly more or the blue Tourmaline from my favorite dealer at the Holidome.  I want to get more carvings this time I sold out all I had purchased last year in two months. Going to get more horses, dogs, cats and dragons. Well, I will get as many cool figures i can this go around.They pack and ship well too. I have a snake necklace i want to do so I'll get some snake carvings for me.
I don't know what else will thrill me this time be we will see. 
Later I will post a partial shopping list. :)

Poor husband had to shovel out the driveway this morning before he could leave for work.
We got 5 inches of snow last night. It took us by surprise. I don't have any appointments until noon- hope it warms enough for me to get out. The weather people keep saying it is supposed to warm up i am skeptical about that. ;)

Today I hit the jackpot!
I bought a big box of spinning /weaving tools at the local 2nd hand store! 
I haven't gone through the box yet- but sitting on the top inside the box was two pair of paddle carders, several drop spindles, a wool ball winder still in the box,  boat shuttles, bobbins and much more.
Yea!

Sitting at home tonight doing nothing on new years. (As per usual)
Really, I have stuff to do , just nothing really great like a party or get together.
Just me and the Pups, and D playing games in his office.
*D just handed me a rum& coke he made me. ;)*
*Takes a drink* Mmmmm!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I don't think I will do a day of ponder, Although it is a fine idea,
I spend plenty of ponder time on a regular basis.
2008 has been a mixed bag for me- Family estrangement, death, personal disappointments and the car wreck. 
There were some bright spots- Pottery school, fun with my girls, and a closer relationship with my spouse.
Things I'd like to work on in 2009
Perfecting my newly recovered pottery skills.
Maintaining closeness in  my relationship.
Trying to keep my word when i give it.
Not jumping into situations trying to fix things. :(
Being a better friend to people I care for.
Making realistic goals  can keep.
Stay on track for the long term ones.
Try to reach out and make new friends.
Get the paranormal team up and going.

A nice start , I think we shall see what the future will bring?
Cheers!
Edited to add: Still sober! ;)

Your result for The Best Thing About You Test...

Intelligence

Intelligence is your strongest virtue

Intelligence (also called intellect) is an umbrella term used to describe a property of the mind that encompasses many related abilities, such as the capacities to reason, plan, and solve problems. And you? Your brain shines. All 7 virtues are a part of you, but your intelligence runs deepest.

It is likely you're a smarty-pants. And it's likely (but not necessary) that your discipline score is high also. It takes a certain resolve to maintain all those neural thingies.

Intelligent famous people: Einstein, Shakespeare, Da Vinci.

Your raw relative scores follow. 0% is low, and 100% is perfect, nearly impossible. Note that I pitted the virtues against each other, so in some way these are relative scores. It's impossible to score high on all of them, and a low score on one is just relatively low compared to the other virtues.

YOUR VIRTUES

20% Compassion

67% Intelligence

0% Humility

67% Honesty

50% Discipline

42% Passion

http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/163330.html

I am at the my Store today after being stranded at the house yesterday.
D-man was kind enough to wait until quarter to eight this morning to drop me off and go into work himself today. So I had a bite of breakfast while the heaters did their thing and opened at nine.
When we pulled up the the door of the building we noticed that the snow had pushed the rain gutters off the eaves and onto the ground.  A huge chunk  of ice fell off the roof just a minute ago. I made a loud bang, lol.
Obviously, I brought the computer along to stave off any boredom that might occur today.
not sure when I will get home but I'll worry about it later. :)
D has promised to take the pup-thang out tonight and tire her out good. Too much energy in that cute 'lil wiggly body!
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/163283.html

I just got in the house and I'm shaking.
Little pup slipped out the door and ran out into our snow covered street.
She barely missed getting hit by a neighbors SUV and then chased it to the corner. 
Thank goodness  the neighbors gate was open and she went in their fenced in yard  to see their dog.  All the while I am struggling in knee deep snow and yelling for her to come to me. The neighbor shooed her out of their yard and she chose to come home and bark at their dog through our adjoining fence.
I took me what seemed forever to flounder to the fence to grab her. She knew she was bagged and didn't fight me to  go in the house. 
Now she is having a time out/nap in her kennel.
We were doing so well. She had not done anything like that in months.
I'm exhausted and chilled from falling and trudging in the snow.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/162995.html

We are so glad the windstorm didn't happen here.Lost power for a little while around three in the morning. but we slept through it all. :)The dogs woke us at 8:00 and D was nice enough tolet the Girls out first thing but they mostly goofed off. 
So now we have about 7-10 inches of new snow on top of the 6 inches already there. I am not sure if we can get out to open the Store today. 
Updates later!
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/162335.html

D-man scraped my windshield in the freezing cold early this morning. What a sweetie!
I spent the day running errands-business banking stuff, groceries, trip to the vet's for dog food.
We are nervous waiting for snow. I really want to open tomorrow. But if there is snow and ice on the road i am not risking falling in the ditch again!
If I don't go there is plenty to do around the house.
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/162140.html

While i am waiting for the PPL to resume doing investigations the end of  February, I am ordering equipment and doing some small scale investigating on my own so I may for real ask you guys to assist. This hobby isn't one you can do well by your self, so If you have any ideas or want to help LJ message me!!!!! 
D an I are in the process of ordering the equipment online this week. The Item I am most excited about , the  Electro magnetic field detector or EMFdetector, will not arrive until the end of December/first of January.
So during the holidays I an looking into some down and dirty work I can accomplish on a Friday or Saturday night.
Tonight, I am looking at some non-contact ifr thermometers. I am leaning toward the pistol type. Maybe less likely to drop. ;) Am looking at gear boxes, headsets-so many toys!
Already have the digital voice recorder and analysis program, and the night vision on my video camera. Need to come up with a red light source for the camera, too. Browsed on the internet last night trying to find a infra-red lighting attachment for my new camera, a Sony HDD handycam DCR-SR85
It is amazing to see how much stuff has been written on this topic. Been reading and printing out stuff every night for the last two weeks.  I also found to books written for paranormal investigation.
So cool!
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/161959.html

you are orange
#FFA500

Your dominant hues are red and yellow... most of what you do is motivated by your need to change things and have a good time, but you've been known to settle down and think out a situation, too. You tend to surprise people just when they're starting to feel like they've got you down.

Your saturation level is very high - you are all about getting things done. The world may think you work too hard but you have a lot to show for it, and it keeps you going. You shouldn't be afraid to lead people, because if you're doing it, it'll be done right.

Your outlook on life is very bright. You are sunny and optimistic about life and others find it very encouraging, but remember to tone it down if you sense irritation.
the spacefem.com html color quiz
http://slysidonia.livejournal.com/161766.html
